DataElement.preferredName: Patient Receive Breast Carcinoma Information From E-mail Recommendation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to if the patient would recommend receiving breast carcinoma information from email.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Receive Breast Carcinoma Information From E-mail Recommendation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._To take, accept, or get something offered._A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._E-mail is short for "electronic mail" and refers to composing, sending, and receiving messages over electronic communication systems. Most e-mail systems use the Internet._Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Receive Breast Carcinoma Information From E-mail Recommendation
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.

A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.
Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
E-mail is short for "electronic mail" and refers to composing, sending, and receiving messages over electronic communication systems. Most e-mail systems use the Internet.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.
